TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AudioQueueProcessingTapFlags extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Flags used when an AudioQueue tap is created, and used by the tap processor callback.

remarks.para: The PostEffects, PreEffects, Siphon values are used both when creating a audio queue tap (using ) and are provided to the tap callback (of type ).
The StartOfStream and EndOfStream are returned by 's GetSourceAudio method.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.AudioToolbox.AudioQueueProcessingTapFlags EndOfStream = unsigned int32(512)

Docs.summary: Indicates the end of the audio stream, it happens when the queue is being stopped asynchronosuly and is returned by a call to GetSourceAudio. You must propagate this value to the caller.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.AudioToolbox.AudioQueueProcessingTapFlags PostEffects = unsigned int32(2)

Docs.summary: The tap is executed after any effects have run.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.AudioToolbox.AudioQueueProcessingTapFlags PreEffects = unsigned int32(1)

Docs.summary: The tap is executed before any effects have run.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.AudioToolbox.AudioQueueProcessingTapFlags Siphon = unsigned int32(4)

Docs.summary: The tap is a siphon tap, it can only examine the AudioBuffers provided to the callback, but should not modify its contents.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MonoTouch.AudioToolbox.AudioQueueProcessingTapFlags StartOfStream = unsigned int32(256)

Docs.summary: Indicates the start of audio and is returned by GetSourceAudio. As a flag passed to a tap processor, this indicates a discontinuity in the audio. Either because it is starting, or because there is a playback gap. For the tap processor this means that the data being requested should correspond to the first frame in the audio source. This should reset any internal state in the tap processor that might have been saved from previous invocations to the tap handler.
